name: SPEC_HOLD_INFO
description: The SPEC_HOLD_INFO table contains information pertaining to holds placed on a specimen.

columns.name: SPECIMEN_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier for the specimen record.

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.

columns.name: HOLD_C_NAME
columns.description: The hold category number for the test specified in column HOLD_TEST_ID.
entries: Collection date too far in past
tc really long name of hold to test in the holds report

columns.name: HOLD_TEST_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier of the test that has a hold on it.

columns.name: HOLD_BEGIN_INS_DTTM
columns.description: The instant when the hold took effect.

columns.name: HOLD_BEGIN_CMT_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier of the note that was made (if any) when the hold was placed.

columns.name: HOLD_CLEAR_INS_DTTM
columns.description: The instant when the hold was cleared. A blank value here means the hold is still active.

columns.name: HOLD_CLEAR_USER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the user who cleared the hold. If this is empty and column HOLD_CLEAR_INS_DTTM has a value, it means the system automatically cleared the hold.

columns.name: HOLD_CLEAR_RSN_C_NAME
columns.description: The category number for the reason the hold was cleared. This should only have a value if column HOLD_CLEAR_INS_DTTM also has a value.
entries: Patient not available to provide information

columns.name: HOLD_CLEAR_CMT_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier of the note that was made (if any) when the hold was cleared.
